hints.content: Substitutional alloys form between elements with similar atomic radii (within $15\%$ of each other), while interstitial alloys form between elements with significantly different atomic radii.

The diagram that best depicts the structure of pewter is

![](https://ka-perseus-images.s3.amazonaws.com/01df44f9ba39b5269c0d32a4aeb1df679d16e63f.svg)

question.content:
In figure skating competitions, the fourth-place finishers are often awarded medals made of pewter, a silvery-white alloy composed of tin and small amounts of antimony and copper. The atomic radii of tin, antimony, and copper are shown in the following table.

Element | Atomic radius
:-: | :-: | :-:
$\ce{Sn}$ | $\pu{140 pm}$
$\ce{Sb}$ | $\pu{141 pm}$
$\ce{Cu}$ | $\pu{128 pm}$

**Based on the data in the table, which of the following diagrams best depicts the structure of pewter?**

[[☃ radio 1]]
